question:
How many colour are available in a computer monitor with 16 bits per pixel depth?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 21/03/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• When a computer monitor uses 16 bits per pixel (also called High Colour), it can display 65,536 colours.
  • This is because 2¹⁶ = 65,536, where each pixel has 16 bits to represent different colour combinations.
  • These bits are typically divided into 5 bits for Red, 6 bits for Green, and 5 bits for Blue, as human eyes are more sensitive to green.

Additional Information:

  • 8-bit colour = 2⁸ = 256 colours
  • 24-bit colour = 2²⁴ = 16,777,216 colours (True Colour)
  • Bit depth determines the range and accuracy of colours shown on the screen.

question:
Which of the following is an input device which can sense light, and is used to point at spots on a video screen?

RRB JE CBT-II 28/08/2019 (Evening)
solution:
• A Light Pen is an input device that can sense light and is used to point directly at spots on a video screen.
  • It works by detecting the light emitted from the screen and sending signals to the computer based on where it's pointed.
  • It was commonly used with CRT (Cathode Ray Tube) monitors for drawing or selecting objects directly on the screen.

Additional Information:

  • A Joystick is used for game control and movement, not for detecting light.
  • A Mouse is also a pointing device but does not sense light on the screen.
  • A Plotter is an output device used for printing vector graphics, not an input device.

question:
__________ keys are present on the top row of the keyboard.

RRB JE 30/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The keys present on the top row of a standard keyboard are called Function keys.
  • These keys are labelled as F1 to F12 and are used to perform specific functions depending on the software being used.
  • Each function key has different actions — for example, F1 usually opens Help, F5 refreshes a page, etc.

Additional Information:

  • Navigation keys (like Home, End, Page Up, Page Down) are usually located in the middle-right section of the keyboard.
  • Arrow keys are found in an inverted T-shape at the bottom-right.
  • Numeric keys are part of the numeric keypad on the far right or above the letter keys (0–9 row), but not the topmost row.

question:
A modem is connected to a:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 23/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• A modem (short for Modulator-Demodulator) is a device used to convert digital signals into analog signals and vice versa for communication over telephone lines.
  • It is typically connected to a phone line to provide internet access through dial-up or broadband connections.
  • The modem serves as a bridge between a computer and the Internet Service Provider (ISP) via the telephone network.

Additional Information:

  • A mouse is a pointing input device and not related to internet connectivity.
  • The motherboard houses the main circuit components of a computer but does not directly connect to a modem.
  • A monitor is an output device used for display and also has no role in connecting the modem.

question:
What is the device or Program called, which enables a computer to transmit data over telephone and cable lines?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The device or program that allows a computer to transmit data over telephone or cable lines is called a Modem.
  • Modem stands for Modulator-Demodulator, which converts digital data from the computer into analog signals for transmission and vice versa for receiving.
  • It is essential for connecting a computer to the Internet via telephone or broadband cable lines.

Additional Information:

  • A Monitor is an output device used to display visual information.
  • A Mouse is an input device used for navigating and selecting on the screen.
  • A Motherboard is the main circuit board of a computer that connects all internal components, but it doesn’t handle data transmission over phone/cable lines.

question:
Which of the following devices performs signal conversion?

RRB JE CBT-II 29/08/2019 (Evening)
solution:
• A Modulator is a device that performs signal conversion, specifically by converting digital signals into analog signals so they can be transmitted over mediums like telephone lines or radio waves.
  • In computer networks, the Modulator is a part of the Modem (Modulator-Demodulator), which handles both modulation and demodulation of signals.
  • This process is essential for communication between digital computers and analog transmission systems.

Additional Information:

  • A Plotter is an output device used for printing large-scale graphics, not signal conversion.
  • A Mouse and Keyboard are input devices, used to interact with the computer but do not perform any signal conversion.

question:
Which of the following is not a storage device?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 26/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• A Modem is not a storage device — it is a communication device used to transmit and receive data over telephone or cable lines.
  • Storage devices are used to store digital data, either temporarily or permanently, and include devices like Hard disk, CD-ROM, and Flash drive.
  • Hence, among the options, Modem does not function as a storage medium.

Additional Information:

  • Hard Disk: A primary storage device used for permanent data storage in computers.
  • CD-ROM: An optical disk that stores data which can only be read (Read-Only Memory).
  • Flash Drive: A portable USB-based storage device used for transferring and storing files.

question:
Which of the following is not used for storage in Computer System?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• An Adder is a combinational circuit used in arithmetic operations, primarily for adding binary numbers, not for storing data.
  • In contrast, Latch, Flip-Flop, and Register are all sequential circuits used to store bits of data in a computer system.
  • Hence, the correct answer is Adder, as it performs calculation, not storage.

Additional Information:

  • Latch: A basic memory device that holds one bit of data using logic gates.
  • Flip-Flop: A more stable and clock-driven storage unit, used in memory and register design.
  • Register: A small, fast storage location within the CPU, used to hold intermediate data and instructions.

question:
Which of the following devices is used for applications like Computer Aided Design (CAD)?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 11/03/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• A Plotter is the correct device used for applications like Computer-Aided Design (CAD).
  • Plotters are output devices that produce high-precision, large-size graphics and drawings, often used by engineers and architects.
  • They can draw continuous lines on paper, unlike printers which produce images using dots, making them ideal for technical blueprints and detailed designs.

Additional Information:

  • Speaker is an output device, but only for audio, not graphics.
  • Pantograph is a mechanical device used for copying a plan or design manually, not digital CAD output.
  • Scanner is an input device used to digitise physical documents or images, not to output CAD drawings.

question:
Normally, A QWERTY keyboard has _________ keys.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 08/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A standard QWERTY keyboard normally has 104 keys in total.
  • These include:
    • Alphabet keys (A–Z)
    • Number keys (0–9)
    • Function keys (F1 to F12)
    • Special keys (Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Enter, Spacebar, etc.)
    • Navigation keys (Arrow keys, Home, End, Page Up, Page Down)
    • Numeric keypad (on the right side in full-sized keyboards)

Additional Information:

  • Laptop keyboards may have fewer keys (e.g., 84 or 86) due to compact design.
  • The QWERTY layout was originally designed for typewriters and remains the most widely used layout for English keyboards.

question:
What is Nomophobia?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/02/2021 (Shift-I)
option_1: Fear of being out of television contact
option_2: Fear of being out of home contact
option_3: Fear of being out of computer contact
option_4: Fear of being out of cellular phone contact
solution:
• Nomophobia stands for "No Mobile Phone Phobia", which is the fear or anxiety of being without access to a mobile phone.
  • It refers to the psychological discomfort caused by loss of signal, battery, or simply not having the phone nearby.
  • It is increasingly common due to rising mobile dependency in modern digital life.

Additional Information:

  • The term "Nomophobia" was coined during a 2008 study conducted in the UK to examine mobile phone usage and anxiety.
  • Symptoms may include restlessness, stress, or panic when a person can't use or locate their phone.
  • It is considered a form of technology-related anxiety disorder.

question:
What type of keyboard is used in fast food store, restaurants and shops?

RRB JE Stage-II 31/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The correct answer is Concept Keyboard — it is commonly used in fast food stores, restaurants, and retail shops.
  • A Concept Keyboard is a flat board with touch-sensitive keys or areas, each programmed for a specific function, like a food item or price.
  • It allows for fast, error-free input and is ideal for environments where speed and simplicity are important.

Additional Information:

  • These keyboards often have custom overlays (like pictures or words) to guide the user.
  • Unlike traditional keyboards, they don’t have alphabet keys and are designed for menu-based input.
  • They are commonly used in Point of Sale (POS) systems for efficiency and ease of use.

question:
A pixel is__________.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 31/07/2021 (Shift-II)
option_2: The smaller resolvable part of a picture
option_3: A picture stored in secondary memory
solution:
• A pixel (short for picture element) is the smallest resolvable or addressable part of a digital image or screen display.
  • Each pixel represents a single point in a graphic image and holds colour information.
  • When thousands or millions of pixels are combined in a grid, they form a complete image on the screen.

Additional Information:

  • Pixel density is often measured in PPI (Pixels Per Inch) — higher the PPI, sharper the image.
  • Resolution (like 1920×1080) refers to the total number of pixels on the screen.
  • Pixels do not exist physically but are logical units in a digital display system.

question:
A/An __________ is an interface on a computer to which you can connect device.

RRB ALP Stage-II 23/01/2019 (Shift-II)
solution:
• A Port is an interface on a computer to which external devices such as keyboard, mouse, printer, USB drives, and monitors can be connected.
  • It serves as a communication point between the computer and the peripheral device.
  • Common types include USB port, HDMI port, Ethernet port, VGA port, etc.

Additional Information:

  • Array refers to a data structure used in programming, not a hardware interface.
  • Anime is a style of animation from Japan and unrelated to computer hardware.
  • Dongle is a small hardware device, often plugged into a port, but not the port itself.

question:
Which of the following output devices is used for translating information from a computer into pictorial form on paper?

RRB JE CBT-II 28/08/2019 (Evening)
solution:
• A Plotter is an output device used to translate digital information from a computer into pictorial (graphical) form on paper.
  • It is specially used to draw complex images, graphs, maps, and architectural blueprints with high precision.
  • Plotters work by moving a pen or printing head over the surface of paper to draw lines and curves.

Additional Information:

  • Touch panel is an input device that allows users to interact with a display screen.
  • Keyboard is also an input device used for typing and commands.
  • Card punch was used in old computing systems for punching holes into cards to store data; it is obsolete now and not used for pictorial output.

question:
In recognition technology OMR is used, what does M stand for?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• OMR stands for Optical Mark Recognition.
  • In this, “M” stands for “Mark”, referring to the marks made by users (usually with pencil or pen) on predefined positions of a form or sheet.
  • OMR technology is used to detect these marks and convert them into digital data, commonly used in exams, surveys, and polls.

Additional Information:

  • OMR sheets are scanned using special OMR scanners that detect the presence or absence of marks.
  • It is different from OCR (Optical Character Recognition), which reads printed text, and MICR (Magnetic Ink Character Recognition), which reads characters printed with magnetic ink (e.g., on cheques).

question:
Which among the following units is used to count the speed of modern printers?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The speed of modern printers is typically measured in PPM, which stands for Pages Per Minute.
  • PPM indicates the number of pages a printer can print in one minute, and it is a standard metric used to compare printer performance.
  • Higher the PPM, faster the printer is considered.

Additional Information:

  • CPM (Characters Per Minute): Used for older character printers like dot matrix printers.
  • LPM (Lines Per Minute): Used in line printers, common in mainframe computing environments.
  • BIT: Stands for binary digit, a unit of digital data, not related to print speed.

question:
Who among the following is considered as the ‘Father of the World Wide Web’?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 05/02/2021 (Shift-I)
option_3: Sir Timothy John Berners-Lee
solution:
• Sir Timothy John Berners-Lee is widely recognised as the Father of the World Wide Web (WWW).
  • He invented the World Wide Web in 1989 while working at CERN (European Organization for Nuclear Research).
  • His invention included the development of key components such as HTML (HyperText Markup Language), HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol), and the first web browser/editor.

Additional Information:

  • Robert Cailliau collaborated with Berners-Lee in the early stages of the web project but is not credited as the sole inventor.
  • James H. Clark is known for his contributions to computer graphics and for founding companies like Netscape.
  • Pei-Yuan Wei developed ViolaWWW, one of the early web browsers, but after the invention of the web.

question:
What is the full form of DPI with regard to digital images?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 23/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The full form of DPI is Dots Per Inch.
  • It refers to the resolution of a printed or digital image, measuring how many individual dots of ink or pixels are present in a linear inch.
  • Higher DPI values mean sharper and more detailed images.

Additional Information:

  • DPI is commonly used in printers, scanners, and monitors to define print quality or display clarity.
  • For example, a printer with 600 DPI can print 600 distinct dots in one inch of a line.
  • It is different from PPI (Pixels Per Inch), which refers to screen resolution, though the terms are often used interchangeably.

question:
Esc key does not use in windows keyboard for-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/04/2016 (Shift-II)
option_1: Switch off the dialogue box
option_4: Switch off a selected drop down list
solution:
• The Esc (Escape) key on a Windows keyboard is not used to select a command.
  • It is commonly used to cancel a command, close a dialog box, or dismiss a drop-down list.
  • Command selection is typically performed using the Enter key or mouse click, not the Esc key.

Additional Information:

  • The Esc key is often used as a universal cancel or exit key in most software applications.
  • It helps users to back out of unwanted operations or menus quickly.
  • The key is located at the top-left corner of standard keyboards.

question:
Which key is used for selecting command is windows keyboard?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 26/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The Enter key on a Windows keyboard is primarily used to select or execute a command.
  • It is often used to confirm choices, submit forms, or run selected menu options in applications.
  • Pressing Enter tells the computer to carry out the currently highlighted or active function.

Additional Information:

  • Tab key is used to navigate between fields or move the cursor to the next input area.
  • End key is used to move the cursor to the end of a line or document.
  • Space bar inserts a space character, not used for selecting commands.

question:
Which is not true about swift key?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 26/04/2016 (Shift-I)
option_1: It is an add on app
option_2: It is an intelligent keyboard
option_3: It is used in the place of normal android keyboard
option_4: It does not support voice typing
solution:
• SwiftKey is a popular add-on app that replaces the default Android keyboard with a more intelligent, predictive, and customisable keyboard.
  • It uses artificial intelligence to learn a user’s writing style and offers auto-correct and next-word prediction.
  • However, the statement “It does not support voice typing” is not true, because SwiftKey does support voice typing through integration with Google Voice Typing.

Additional Information:

  • SwiftKey was originally developed by TouchType Ltd. and was later acquired by Microsoft in 2016.
  • It supports multiple languages, swipe typing, and even themes for customisation.
  • The app can be used as a complete replacement for the default keyboard on Android devices.

question:
Full form of ICR is-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/01/2017 (Shift-I)
option_4: Institute for Cyber Research
solution:
• The full form of ICR is Intelligent Character Recognition.
  • It is an advanced form of OCR (Optical Character Recognition) that can read and understand handwritten characters.
  • ICR software uses artificial intelligence and machine learning to improve accuracy over time as it learns different handwriting styles.

Additional Information:

  • ICR is commonly used in banking, form processing, and document digitisation where handwritten data needs to be converted into digital text.
  • Unlike traditional OCR which works best with printed text, ICR can interpret cursive and freehand writing.
  • It is part of intelligent document processing systems for automated data extraction.

question:
Full form of PCB is-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 07/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The full form of PCB is Printed Circuit Board.
  • A PCB is a flat board that holds and connects electronic components using conductive tracks, pads, and other features etched from copper sheets.
  • It is widely used in electronic devices such as computers, mobiles, televisions, and industrial machines.

Additional Information:

  • PCBs come in various types — single-layer, double-layer, and multi-layer — depending on complexity.
  • Components like resistors, capacitors, ICs, and connectors are soldered onto the PCB to create functioning circuits.
  • PCBs help in compact design, reliable connections, and ease of assembly in electronics manufacturing.

question:
Which of the following phone is not related to touch panel sensing patterns?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 11/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The correct answer is Voice recognition, as it is not related to touch panel sensing patterns.
  • Touch panel sensing technologies detect physical interaction (like a finger or stylus) with the screen.
  • Options like finger touch, gloved touch, and light transmittance all relate to how touch screens detect or respond to input.

Additional Information:

  • Voice recognition is a separate input technology that recognises and processes spoken commands, not physical touches.
  • Finger touch and gloved touch involve capacitive or resistive sensing.
  • Light transmittance plays a role in optical touch screens, where interruption of light beams detects touch.

question:
Full form of DVD is-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The full form of DVD is Digital Versatile Disc.
  • It is a digital optical disc storage format used for storing data, videos, software, and multimedia content.
  • DVDs offer higher storage capacity than CDs, typically 7 GB for single-layer and 8.5 GB for dual-layer versions.

Additional Information:

  • DVDs can be used for both read-only and read-write purposes (e.g., DVD-ROM, DVD-R, DVD-RW).
  • DVD technology became widely popular in the late 1990s for movies and software distribution.
  • It is read by a laser beam in DVD drives or players.

question:
Which of the following is not an output device?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 11/04/2017 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The correct answer is (d) Processor, as it is not an output device.
  • A Processor (also known as CPU – Central Processing Unit) is the brain of the computer that processes instructions, performs calculations, and manages data flow — but it does not produce output in the form visible to the user.
  • Output devices are those that display or present data from the computer to the user.

Additional Information:

  • Web camera, BCR (Bar Code Reader), and Digitizer are also not output devices — they are input devices.
  • However, among the given options, only the Processor is a processing device, not input or output.
  • Output devices include Monitor, Printer, Speakers, Plotter, etc.

question:
Which of the following options represents the number of pixels per inch printed on a page?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 13/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The correct answer is (b) Resolution, which refers to the number of pixels per inch (PPI) or dots per inch (DPI) printed on a page or displayed on a screen.
  • In the context of printing, resolution defines the clarity and detail of the image — higher resolution = sharper print.
  • It determines how much image detail can be printed within a given space.

Additional Information:

  • Print margin refers to the blank area around the edges of the page, not image sharpness.
  • Filter refers to image processing effects (e.g., blur, sharpen), not pixel count.
  • Colour mode determines how colours are represented (like RGB or CMYK), not how many pixels are printed per inch.

question:
In which instrument the gyroscope is used?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 18/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The correct answer is (b) Mouse — specifically, motion-sensing or air mice use gyroscopes.
  • A gyroscope is a device that detects orientation and angular movement.
  • In mice, it helps to track the direction and tilt of hand movements, allowing the cursor to move without a surface (in air).

Additional Information:

  • Gyroscopes are also used in smartphones, drones, game controllers, and VR headsets to detect motion and rotation.
  • A keyboard, telephone, or television does not use a gyroscope for its normal operation.
  • Gyroscopic mice are helpful for presentations, gaming, and gesture-based control systems.

question:
Which pointing device in a computer works by detecting two dimensional motion related to its supporting surface?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 04/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Mouse — it is a pointing device that works by detecting two-dimensional motion relative to its supporting surface (like a mousepad or desk).
  • When the mouse is moved, sensors detect movement along the X (horizontal) and Y (vertical) axes and translate it into cursor movement on the screen.
  • This allows users to interact with graphical elements like buttons, menus, and icons.

Additional Information:

  • Pointer refers to the on-screen cursor, not the hardware device.
  • Tracker could refer to devices like trackballs or eye-tracking systems but is not a standard term for the primary pointing device.
  • Keyboard is an input device used for typing text and commands — not for pointing or motion detection.

question: Punched card also known as-
solution:
• The correct answer is (a) Hollerith card — a punched card is also known as a Hollerith card, named after Herman Hollerith, who developed it for data processing in the late 19th century.
  • Punched cards were used to store and process data by encoding information through holes punched in predefined positions.
  • These were widely used in early computers and mechanical tabulating machines for tasks like census processing and data entry.

Additional Information:

  • Video card is used to render visual output to a monitor.
  • Sound card processes audio input and output.
  • Accelerator card is used to enhance computer performance (e.g., graphics or computation speed).
  • None of these perform data storage through physical punching like the Hollerith card.

question:
Which of the following device work as an input as well as output device?

RRB SSE 21/12/2014
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) Modem, which functions as both an input and output device.
  • A Modem (Modulator-Demodulator) converts digital signals to analog (for transmission) and analog signals back to digital (for reception), enabling two-way communication.
  • Thus, it receives data from the internet (input) and sends data from the computer (output).

Additional Information:

  • Joystick and Mouse are purely input devices used to send control signals to the computer.
  • A Printer is a pure output device, used to produce physical output on paper.
  • Only the Modem handles bidirectional signal processing, making it suitable as both input and output.

question:
What is pixel?

RRB JE 14/12/2014
option_1: A computer program which make pictures
option_2: Storing the picture in secondary memory
option_3: The smallest part of picture resolution
option_4: None of the above
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) The smallest part of picture resolution.
  • A pixel (short for picture element) is the smallest unit of a digital image or display that can be individually coloured and controlled.
  • When many pixels are arranged in a grid, they form a complete image on a screen.

Additional Information:

  • The number of pixels determines the resolution of the image or display — more pixels = higher clarity.
  • Pixel density is usually measured in PPI (Pixels Per Inch) or DPI (Dots Per Inch).
  • Pixels are not physical dots, but logical units that represent colour and brightness values.

question:
Intel Core i9 is a kind of ____________ .

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/12/2020 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The correct answer is (b) Processor — Intel Core i9 is a type of high-performance microprocessor developed by Intel Corporation.
  • It belongs to the Intel Core series (i3, i5, i7, i9) and is designed for advanced computing tasks such as gaming, content creation, and high-end software applications.
  • The Core i9 features multiple cores, high clock speeds, and hyper-threading, making it ideal for multitasking and processing-heavy operations.

Additional Information:

  • Anti-Virus is software used to detect and remove malicious programs (e.g., Norton, McAfee).
  • Motherboard is the main circuit board that connects all components of a computer.
  • Hard-disk is a storage device used to save data and files.

question:
__________ A hardware device is usually located on the motherboard of a computer and severs as the internal memory of the CPU.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 24/07/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The correct answer is (c) RAM — Random Access Memory is a hardware component located on the motherboard and acts as the internal memory of the CPU.
  • RAM stores data and instructions temporarily that the CPU needs while performing tasks. It is volatile, meaning the data is lost when the power is turned off.
  • It allows for fast access and processing, enabling smooth functioning of applications and the operating system.

Additional Information:

  • CD-ROM, DVD-ROM, and Floppy are all external storage devices, not internal memory. They are non-volatile and mainly used for data storage or transfer, not direct CPU operations.
  • RAM is crucial for multitasking and overall system performance.
